purpose.description: Great job! Your code fulfills the main project objectives: you updated font weights, line heights, font families, and included Google Fonts and a custom font. The site is visually improved and more readable.
You set the correct font weights for the header, banner h2, and h1, and applied the specified line-heights to journal, quote, and footer elements.
Suggestion: The fallback font for the .journal section should be 'serif' only, not 'Work Sans', serif, to match the task. Consider updating for full accuracy.

readability.description: Your CSS is well-organized, with clear section comments and consistent indentation, making it easy to follow.
Suggestion: Add brief comments above key font-family and font-weight changes to help future readers quickly identify typography decisions.
Suggestion: For consistency, use lowercase and hyphenated class names (e.g., .first-letter instead of .first_letter) and keep naming uniform throughout.

performance.description: You efficiently use CSS selectors and media queries to ensure the site is responsive and typography adapts to different screen sizes.
Suggestion: To further optimize, group shared font-family fallbacks into CSS variables for easier future updates.
Suggestion: Double-check that all Google Fonts weights (400, 500, 800 for Work Sans; 400, 400 italic for Merriweather) are being used where needed, to avoid unnecessary font loading.
